__e: I have always had this one thought, ever since I was a nipper, to ring the church bells, good and loud.
Listen, I was wondering if it's at all possible, can you, like, not ring the church bells for like a hour, an hour and a half?
What worried me the most in this moment, was probably that I couldn't/i hear the church bells.

What worried me the most in this moment, was probably that I couldn't/i hear the church bells.
Listen, I was wondering if it's at all possible, can you, like, not ring the church bells for like a hour, an hour and a half?
The day we made those windchimes...
I don't know if boys are still into wind chimes these days, but I hope their gentle tinklings will always remind you of home.
The hottest topic in town is whether or not there are wedding bells in Sam and Janet's future.
We'll get out of here, and... we'll be listening to wedding bells, before you can say when.
They sound like school bells between classes.
Tell him I'll be there with bells on.
Well, I'm going to see him this afternoon, when three bells ring in the church.
With a temple in your mind, you'll *hear the bells ringing in your heart.
There were ringing bells and music played somewhere.
If you just wait for the bells, then you'll get to hear them... then you'll know what time it is.
Don't worry, I'll be there with bells on.
That man can flat-out ring the bells of heaven when you get him going.
But if it should happen, Schultz, I promise you you will be the first one to hear those wedding bells.
Is that wedding bells I hear?
